titleStmt.title: Samuel L. Taylor to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1833

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Philada April 4th. 1864.
Hon. Thomas E. Bramlette.
Governor of Kentucky &c. &c.
Dear Sir

Some time since I held a Commission as Commissioner of Deeds &c for your State, which I suffered to expire by limitation. I am now desirous to renew the same, and accordingly make this application. I am, should it be requisite ready to furnish what I cannot but think would be satisfactory recommendation; and also to pay the State Department's fee if pre-requisite. Will you please advise me what to do. I hold Commissions from 24 States.

Very Respectfully
Samuel L. Taylor
No. 423 Walnut St.

Atty & Comm'r.
Pennsylvania
Commr Deeds
Apptd
7th Apl/64
